New Records: England became the first men's team to hold both the 50-over and T20 World Cup titles simultaneously
Key Match Events: Ben Stokes starred in the match with his unbeaten 52 from 49 balls, propelling England to their target of 138 with an over to spare
Sam Curran (3-12), Adil Rashid (2-22) and Chris Jordan (2-27) had earlier excelled with the ball, restricting Pakistan to 137-8
Stokes clinched his first international T20 half-century with the four that levelled the scores, before hauling the single through the leg-side that took England to the title
Pre-Game Insights: England were looking to add the T20 trophy to the 50-over silverware they had lifted in dramatic style at Lordâ€™s in 2019
Post-Match Reflections: Ben Stokes expressed pride in the team's resilience after a close win
England's victory marked a significant morale booster ahead of the World Cup
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played on a spicy pitch against a fine and fired-up Pakistan bowling attack
England secured a second T20 World Cup title, after their success in the Caribbean in 2010
England will remain in Australia to play a three-match one-day international series against Australia
Others: Shaheen Shah Afridi injured himself taking a brilliant catch at long-off, and subsequently pulled up one ball into the 16th over
